history.content:
I double majored in Applied Math and Computer Science and I still had time to study abroad. It's not too terrible to fit into your schedule, since you can def. get requirements checked off abroad (I'm not entirely sure, but I think studying abroad might automatically fulfill international studies), and CS doesn't have that many required classes.

I've had friends do the math in Budapest program, which I've heard good things about. I studied abroad in London which I thought was OK, since I didn't really like the city that much.

children.subject: I talked about my study abroad experience a bit here, agree with the answer above it's definitely possible! @3373

history.content: I'm a first-year LSCS student, and I'd really like to study abroad. I know I should be able to fit it in with the degree requirements for CS, since there aren't tooo many, but I don't know anyone who's done this. If anyone could share their study abroad experiences or recommend specific programs to look at that would be great. Also, can I fulfill my LS breadths abroad? Thanks!
history.subject: Study abroad?
